intro: Tubiflora angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed tubeflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It features slender, upright stems that are often hairy and bear small, tubular flowers in shades of pink to purple. The leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a slightly serrated edge, and they are arranged alternately along the stem. This plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Its flowering period typically occurs in late spring to early summer, adding a delicate touch of color to gardens.
